alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 8:40PM CST until March 04 at 8:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Wapsipinicon River near De Witt 4S affecting Clinton and Scott Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois... Cedar River near Conesville affecting Louisa and Muscatine Counties. Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Whiteside and Henry IL Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Water affects low lying agricultural land. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 12.0 feet. - The river has crested and will slowly fall through the weekend. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
